intro: Puccinellia waginiae, commonly known as the Mongolian glassworts, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Poaceae. It is a perennial grass that typically grows in saline and alkaline soils, often found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is adapted to harsh environments, with mechanisms to tolerate high salt concentrations. Puccinellia waginiae plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing forage for livestock in its native habitats.
